website_summaries.verdict: With overheat protection and a lid lock, this electric coffee grinder has fantastic safety features.
pros: Electric grinder for coffee bean and spices
Stainless steel blade and stainless steel exterior
Top cover design ensures grounds don't spill out
cons: Can't remove grinder bowl to clean it

website_summaries.verdict: Espresso fans will love the consistent, fine grounds this Secura model delivers. You need to clean the fine powder out very well, though, because it can build up and trigger the machine's safety lock.
pros: For use with coffee beans and spices
Smart overheat protection extends motor life
Can handle a small, fine grind very well
cons: Manufacturer recommends not running it for more than 20 seconds at a time to save the motor life

customer_reviews.title: Not stainless steel where the beans are ground...
customer_reviews.text: What's the point of this product? You're paying a premium just for some useless stainless steel shell on the outside of a regular plastic coffee grinder, with a really annoying screw-on lid. I bought this thinking I had finally found a true stainless steel coffee grinder with now stupid carcinogenic plastic built in where the coffee is ground, but I was wrong. The stainless steel is literally just for looks. It has no functionality at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: (35 years of grinding beans) This model for some reason grinds faster and finer than any
customer_reviews.text: This coffee grinder grinds incredibly well. I have owned Krupp, Kitchen aid and Hamilton beach.. (35 years of grinding beans) This model for some reason grinds faster and finer than any. I have used it every day for over 4 months and the motor seems fine. I do not pulse just have it on and shake. The only slight drawback is the top can get a little hard to close after a while because of very fine coffee grinds in the top cap track. I simply use a brush to clean it and it's great for weeks. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Menelfloss

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, easy clean metal spice grinder
customer_reviews.text: Very quickly produced finely ground garam masala. My old grinder had begun leaving large bits and I needed a reliable replacement. Thanks to Amazon reviews I picked this one. And so far I'm really pleased with it. I have also used this to grind almonds. So it was essential to be easy to clean to remove any residue from the last use. There isn't a removable grinding cup, but the smooth metal inside makes it easy to wipe clean. ( I wash it with water, making sure not to immerse, nor let water get into the motor). The lid is easy to clean too. So very happy with this powerful, easy clean grinder.
customer_reviews.author: mumto4boys

customer_reviews.title: Coffee and Spice Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grinder specifically to grind flax seeds and it does it perfectly. In fact, it works better than any comparable grinder that I have used in the past. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry J. Marble

customer_reviews.title: Bad lid design
customer_reviews.text: As others noted the safety features in the lid break and unit will not run. Lasted almost three months. Only grinding flax seed two to three tablespoons a day. Design should be altered so that catch units should be doubled so that less pressure in placed on individual catches and safety on off bumps are not placed together with catch. Simple design change would get units to last longer without adding more than one half cent (or one yuan) to cost of production.
customer_reviews.author: R. Chlumberger

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the price at $13.99 but I really regretted to buy this when I started using because of the design that doesn’t let my hand hold it easily for getting coffee out. The circumference in the middle part is 12 inches and the bottom part is 13 inches (as you see my photos) which is too big for me to hold. I used to have “Bodum” brand electric coffee grinder which design was slim and great for me to hold it and get the coffee out. Second, the blade isn’t good. So don’t buy this for the lower price. It is for long term use so that $22 Bodum’s design and blade are better.
customer_reviews.author: SMC

customer_reviews.title: Poor lid design
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve only used this a couple times. But the lid apparatus is frustrating! After some time, I realized that it’s a turn and lift lid. But it is not easy to grip, and if you have wet or lotioned hands...forget it. Mainly, though, it was after I tried it out, took the lid off to inspect the coffee & realized it needed more grinding, that I couldn’t get it to work! Turns out the slightest bit of grounds or coffee dust on the rim of the unit will prevent the lid from locking into “go” position. Frustration! Overall poor lid design.
customer_reviews.author: hitchcockfan2

customer_reviews.title: Good grinder, but cheap lid makes it a bad choice. It won’t last
customer_reviews.text: Product is designed with a lid that easily fails. The safety clips on the lid break easily and then you cannot turn the thing on. You cannot just replace the cheap lid, you have to throw the whole thing away! It would be nice if the manufacturer sold just the lid so that you didn’t have to be so wasteful. AVOID. Didn’t even make it a year
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Will Hellme

customer_reviews.title: Make sure the lid clicks!
customer_reviews.text: Our only issue with this fine grinder is that you must "click" the lid in place before grinding. The first time I used it, I spent a good ten minutes trying to get it to work....I thought we got a dud....I actually called my husband at work (he had used it before I did) to get any tips on getting it to grind. You do have to play with the lid and make sure it clicks. Once it gets going, it grinds well and evenly (we only use ours for herbs & spices). It is relatively inexpensive so I sure hope it holds out for us.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of this grinder doesn't do a good job and I like to be able to remove and wash, not just wipe out.
customer_reviews.author: Denise walton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grinder for powderizing dried herbs.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this grinder to powderize dried herbs for making purcolated tinctures. This grinder does the job very well. I found it a little difficult to clean the fine powder out of the grinder. First time I tried a dampened paper towel. I didn't like the results of that cleaning procedure. The following times I blew the residual herb powder out with an air compressor. That worked much better.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Girl

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in Aug. 2014 to replace my old one that I'd given to my daughter. I've used this one about four times without any issues - until yesterday. I poured my flax seed in, plugged it in, and pushed the button. Nothing happened. I played with the cord - plugged it into a different outlet. Nothing. Another outlet. Nothing. I played with the cap. Opened and closed it. Nothing. Just to stress - I had no warning. It just didn't turn on again. I always pulsed it to grind and never over a few seconds at a time. I used it four times before it just stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: TMB

customer_reviews.title: Plastic inside top broke in 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until the plastic inside the cab that locks it broke. So even though the lid is on tight. It will not work. Bought it in January of 2018. Started having trouble getting it to turn on little by little. Then noticed plastic was worn out. Oh well. Update 5/26 Company contacted me and sent me another one, that is a company that stands behind its warranty without jumping thru all kinds of red tape. Thank you, God Bless America. I like the grinder, works well, the top is a issue or I would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Frost

customer_reviews.title: Grinds fine, but not easily
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as a spice grinder, and it's kind of a hassle to use. It flings the material very high up the sides, and when it becomes fine enough it sticks to the lid, and gets in a bunch of crevices that lock around the base. Nothing comes out but whenever I finish grinding I have to take a small brush and clean maybe a teaspoon of spice off the lid and the rest out of the container because it tends to stick. It might stop sticking as I use it but out of the box it's not as convenient as I was hoping it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Impossible Lid
customer_reviews.text: The lid is practically impossible to use. You have to line up the arrows with the unlock icon on the grinder, and then turn the lid to the lock position. Note that the lid is slippery as all get out with nothing to grip while you're turning to lock position. So your hands just spin and spin as you're trying to turn the lid to lock position. Completely over engineered. Did they think that those pesky beans were going to escape whilst being ground? For heavens sake. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Londa

customer_reviews.title: Don’t need this hassle before I start my day...
customer_reviews.text: The lid has to be screwed on at a precise starting point and is then very difficult to lock in place, out of box it was very stiff and will not grind unless it is closed exactly as intended. I don’t need this fight every morning to make a cup of coffee. Then I read the reviews that said the plastic parts breaking after a Short time period .... I sent it back and bought a grinder locally that I could test in the store
customer_reviews.author: DRA

customer_reviews.title: No froth after
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in a deal and was doing a great job then I stop using it for a few week then when I use it again it doesn't froth anymore. I dont know what is wrong with this appliance.!?? Maybe the seller can answer the question!!?? It is a very nice looking machine and fast in the beginning then stop it only gives hot milk with no froth.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Lee

customer_reviews.title: clean w a brush
customer_reviews.text: It grinds well, sorta loud. No spout to pour grounds from, coffee sticks pretty badly, so you'll need to clean it regularly or it will get a little rancid. It has held up though, and I like a pretty fine grind.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Hull

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Works great if you like scraping what you've done out of the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Covert

customer_reviews.title: If the plastic latches break, the device is not usable.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the product thinking I was getting a deal and that should have been my first red flag. The plastic latches that lock into place when twisting the tight were never a one and done. Most of the time I found myself trying to twist and line of the grooves multiple times. The latches finally broke after 4 months of use and now the grinder does not work. Not the way to start a morning when trying to brew some coffee. I am pretty disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon RIley

customer_reviews.title: We are not satisfied with our order- the grinder does not hold a ...
customer_reviews.text: We are not satisfied with our order- the grinder does not hold a reasonable amount of coffee beans for grinding, resulting in many repeated uses to grind enough coffee for an average sized coffee pot. Also the base of the grinder leaves residual coffee after it's been ground forcing you to have to scrape it out, which results in a messy grinding experience. This is not a user friendly machine.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Traff

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: This grinder grinds coffee well. However when the grinds get caught on the lid, the lid won't close and the grinder does not work. You need a brush after every use in order to get the grinders safety to engage. This grinder quit working after less than 30 uses. Buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It's is a great little grinder, using it to grind coffee beans and Chaga mushroom, so far works great. The ground coffee does really stick to the inside grinding canister luckily I had a brush from an old one bc there is no brush included to get it out, maybe I'm over grinding it, I do like a very fine grind, which it does wonderfully...
customer_reviews.author: Lovnliberty

customer_reviews.title: great grinder and will turn most spices into talc if ...
customer_reviews.text: Quite the grinder. The top needs to be turned completely clockwise till it stops in order for it to work. My first few attempts were in vain as I did not turn it around far enough till it stopped. Anyways, great grinder and will turn most spices into talc if you run it too long. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: steve musselman

customer_reviews.title: Daily grind.
customer_reviews.text: I think the design could have been better. It grinds just fine so the function is fine. But, the cover is difficult to line up and secure. It screws on but you have to get it just right. There are no alignment markings. It is also difficult to remove whatever you have ground up.
customer_reviews.author: KDDid

customer_reviews.title: Great little grinder!
customer_reviews.text: This little grinder gets the job done. It's way more sturdy and effective than others at this price point and in my experience outperforms even more expensive grinders. I had one for about 7 years, and it endured constant use and abuse (including being dropped, etc). It finally broke and we tried to replace it with a different brand name grinder just to see what was out there. When we saw the difference we immediately returned it and bought another secura instead.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa R. Oglesby

customer_reviews.title: Messy
customer_reviews.text: The bowl does not come off so you get coffee grounds everywhere. Buy a Mr. Coffee and save yourself the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: OM

customer_reviews.title: Its For Beans
customer_reviews.text: Great small grinder, works well, grinds very fine, and the safety feature that prevents operation actually *works*. I keep it functional and clean with an old toothbrush, and am not expecting any problems. There's nothing like fresh-ground beans for the morning Cup of Jane.
customer_reviews.author: Shari A. Mann

customer_reviews.title: Simple, small coffee grinder.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to grind my coffee beans for cold brew. This grinder is super simple to use and a sleek, small design. I can easily tuck it into my cabinet so it doesn’t have to sit out. It grinds the coffee beans perfectly and I am even able to use it at night while my kids are asleep without waking them. One of my favorite features is that you have to have the lid on just right in order to power it on, as a mom of little ones I highly appreciate this!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Guise

customer_reviews.title: Easy product BUT cheap materials, short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this two months ago. The top piece cracked after regular daily use for only two months. I didn’t want to leave a bad review, but it’s impossible to figure out how to contact the company to see if they’ll replace the top piece. Also, maybe use a more durable plastic in the next version...
customer_reviews.author: another opinion

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine. If I had to pick something I don’t like, it’s the cleaning of the vessel. You can only wipe it out to clean.. it does a great job grinding! Great addition to any kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: kjdf

customer_reviews.title: I love the size of this grinder
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of this grinder, and that it is stainless steel, and the viewer window on top, but the cord, which will wrap at the bottom, is very awkward to do. I just don't bother, as it is too much of a pain to wrap. It grinds nicely, and quickly. It's worth the purchase. especially if you are concerned with counter space.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Sarver

customer_reviews.title: It's a great product!
customer_reviews.text: I have this grinder now a year. I use it almost every day. I love it! It works well, it's easy to use and clean. I enjoy its very ergonomic design. This grinder looks nice on the countertop in between other kitchen tools. I appreciate it all a lot!
customer_reviews.author: ali

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is good. I use it to grind spices. Cleans up fairly easily and has good cosmetics. It really doesn't hold enough volume to grind much coffee, though, unless you're just grinding enough fo a cup or two.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended if you have any arthritis in hands
customer_reviews.text: Too hard to get the lid off, shouldn't be that difficult. It took longer to get the lid back on right in order for the grinder to work, than it did to grind a 2 lb bag of coffee beans. I had to get the instruction booklet out to see if there was some kind of trick I was missed. I don't remember how much this cost me, but it was too much. I gave it to a friend. Not recommended if you have any arthritis in hands.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Overbay

customer_reviews.title: Small and needs to be kept clean for it to work.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 8 months and is no longer working. I have used it daily. I've had grinders last me several years so I don't think this is the greatest. It worked ok. Super loud and had to be cleaned thoroughly for it to work. Would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: RIA

customer_reviews.title: Cheap gourmet coffee
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I bought this thing was because I accidentally bought coffee beans at the grocery store. I had to act like I knew what I was doing. And wow! What a difference in the coffee! It works great. Great price too. Every coffee drinker should grind their own beans without spending so much money. It works on spices as well
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Butcher

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Coffee Grinders on the Market
customer_reviews.text: Once I got the hang of getting the top on correctly this became one of the best coffee grinders we have ever had. We grind coffee beans each day, this gives a uniform fine grind and is a very sturdy machine. Looks good and grinds better than most. Solid and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Totten

customer_reviews.title: Don't throw away the box.
customer_reviews.text: Well I had bad luck with this. Got it to work once (after much effort). Never worked again. My mistake getting rid of the box or I would have returned it. Seems like it would have been a good one (worked beautifully that one time). I got a dud.
customer_reviews.author: LauraSG

customer_reviews.title: Okay, so I purchased in November and just pulled ...
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I purchased in November and just pulled it out to use for the first time. Pulsed one small handful of beans and now it won't work......great
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Snow

customer_reviews.title: safety switch malfunctions,
customer_reviews.text: no settings for course or fine grind breaks after 1st use...great form but does not function....now a paper weight...I'm working on a youtube video reviewing this sekura crap..scammer dont buy
customer_reviews.author: Mister Dryer

customer_reviews.title: I just can't believe a completely new product could do such a bad job! Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: It only worked 10 seconds!!! I just turned it on and tested it. After 10 minutes when I am tried to use it, it died! Thanks for those reviews that told me that this is a common problem they also had met! But it still took me more than one hour to figure out what really happened! I just can't believe a completely new product could do such a bad job! Waste of time!
customer_reviews.author: Lixin

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I use this more than I thought I would. Mostly use for grinding spices. Can be a bit fiddly to clean the inside, but you can' beat the price and grinds really well.
customer_reviews.author: E. Simuns

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, exactly what I hoped for!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this grinder. It is exactly as described and even better. Surprisingly easy to clean, sized just right, the directions for use are clear and concise, and it does not take up too much room on my counter. I store it away with ease or leave it where it is at. I can easily managed how fine to grind the beans too.
customer_reviews.author: Jenifer

customer_reviews.title: The lock is impossible.  Terrible product!
customer_reviews.text: I never leave negative reviews but this coffee grinder is so bad I feel I should. It is impossible to lock and unlock. I’m pretty strong but I barely have the hand strength to do it. Since I can’t engage the lock I can’t use it. It was a complete waste of money but I waited to long to use it so I can’t return it. I am buying a different one now.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Started smoking
customer_reviews.text: At first it worked well but I’m giving one stars because it started to smoke after few times of use and it hasn’t been three months yet. I used it rarely. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: nasrin akhter

customer_reviews.title: Great for a variety of spices!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this grinder because of how easy it is to clean, as well as the cosmetics. The grind I had before did not grind coffee beans very evenly, so I was glad that when I tried this one out it appeared to be pretty smooth! I have used this grinder for a few different spices as well, and have found the same result. It's easy to clean out between uses! I would recommend this to a friend for the value and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Good

customer_reviews.title: Over all it is perfect. It grind spices really fine and I like ...
customer_reviews.text: Over all it is perfect. It grind spices really fine and I like it. The only reason I gave it four star is because after grinding the spices, the powdery spices would be all over the top rim of the unit and it’s kind of a little mess when opening the top.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: quiet grinder
customer_reviews.text: the lid locking and unlocking was very hard at first.my wife cant use it with bad wrist. i ground 28 oz of coffee with it and did great job. i recommend using a wrung out wet wash rag and clean offthreads every 4 grindings. i think 2or3 bags of coffee it will get easier
customer_reviews.author: C. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Works if you turn cap clock wise to lock
customer_reviews.text: Using it for spices and will get another for coffee as cleaning it to perfection is a pain. Recommended damp cloth only work so far so a dedicated mill makes more sense with coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Limey

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the right price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really handy product. It does a great job doing what it is made to do. I use it mainly for grinding coffee beans, and have had no problems. It doesn’t have a setting on it but you can grind the beans a course or as fine as you want them depending on how long you run the grinder. I definitely recommend this item. Does a great job and comes at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Quiet & Efficient
customer_reviews.text: First let me start by saying that nowhere on the net did I find the capacity. I turns out that it handles enough beans in one grind for 10 (5 oz) cups. This works fine for the 2 of us. Meanwhile if you need more its easy just to grind more. After our (very old) Braun was no longer grinding to our satisfaction I bought the Secura. It is much much quieter than the Braun and the grind is excellent. I pretty picky about the look and this one goes great with our stainless steel appliances. It's small footprint is just right for our small kitchen. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Muriel Fahrion

customer_reviews.title: Nice value, compact.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for coffee or spices. Clean bowl very well between uses to prevent cross flavors.
customer_reviews.author: Michael O. Davis

customer_reviews.title: works great, but use with caution
customer_reviews.text: It runs quietly and works quickly. The only thing is,I did not know until it arrived that you cannot run any moist material in it or chocolate. I was hoping to do that. Also it only recommends a very small amount, not greater than 1.8 oz. at one time. The lid has to be well cleaned between runs b/c powder will fall on the rim, preventing a clean re-seal of the lid. Then it will not run.
customer_reviews.author: NW Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality and unsafe
customer_reviews.text: The locking mechanism made of tiny cheap plastic part broke after 4 weeks. I had to stuck a piece of wood to bypass the security and now I’m left with a blade that can start at anytime with my wife’s finger in it. Not worth the money. Bad design and item to avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Remi

customer_reviews.title: Works well but lid is a little challenging to open and close.
customer_reviews.text: Grinds beans nicely only complaint I have is lid is a bit difficult to get on and off and isn't marked where to line up so at 4am when just waking up its a little irritating trying to open and close
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 4 Boys

customer_reviews.title: No removable cup
customer_reviews.text: This is probably an alright coffee grinder, but I wanted one with a removable cup, so I ordered a different one and gave this one away as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: C. Toombs

customer_reviews.title: Broke After Three Months!
customer_reviews.text: At first glance, this coffee grinder looked as though it would do the trick for grinding coffee beans. Over time, with one use per day, the lid became increasingly difficult to engage. If the lid does not engage, the unit does not operate. Turns out, the plastic rim under the lid had cracked, causing the notches not to match anymore. No match, no grind. Into the trash after 3 months!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Good Looking and High Functioning Coffee Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I use this for coffee beans only and it still works like the day I bought it! I have had it for almost a year now and use it almost daily, weekly at the very least. I even see it as a piece of decor in my kitchen. It tends to leave a layer of coffee grinds on the bottom. Which isn't very significant except when I'm grinding beans for one cup of coffee. Nevertheless, it really doesn't bother me. I'd buy it again if it broke somehow!
customer_reviews.author: WexAmz

customer_reviews.title: Can grinds into fine powder in seconds
customer_reviews.text: My Blendtec died and frankly I just couldn't afford a new one right now. I make a morning shake that includes Chia Seeds and the blendtec broke them down. Now I'm using a blender I had for some years. It works okay except for the chia seeds. Just couldn't grind those up. Brought the Grinder because it said it was a spice grinder. I'm so glad I did. In a matter of seconds, this grinder reduces chia seeds to a fine powder. Its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Clair Moffitt

customer_reviews.title: Secura Coffee and Spice Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about my grinder. I am so excited because, for a long time I have been searching for a grinder for my flax seed. This is the best I have found. Oh God, my black pepper, it's like powder. All that I have ground is perfectly done. I will recommend to anyone that's looking for a grinder, go out and buy the Secura Coffee and spice grinder. The best thing since Kentucky Fried Chicken. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Florence

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst grinder I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst grinder I have ever used! It is very hard to open and close the lid and if the lid isn't forcefully on it won't work! I spend just a few minutes every time I want to use it, just trying to get the thing to close, so it will work. Then it doesn't grind very well. Then it is just as hard to get the lid back off it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and quiet grind
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and quiet grind. I do 6-8 second grinds, pause, then grind again for finely ground beans. Can also be used for nuts such as almonds and pecans. It might have residue on the bottom after grinding, just tap it a few times after and it will come off.
customer_reviews.author: Viktor V

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend to everyone!!!! I am satisfied!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s been 3 years.. it is really worth and very good spice grinder!!!! Obviously No negative feedbacks from me!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pavithran

customer_reviews.title: Lid broke even after juditious use- hoping to get repaired under warrenty
customer_reviews.text: I used to love this product until the lid of my grinder broke from inside. I am happy to found that product is covered with 1 year warrently. Contacted tge seller. Lets see if that works.
customer_reviews.author: Bharti malhotra

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: This Grinder is easy to you I use it for coffee beans and it works very good. Great product if you need 1 I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry D Davis

customer_reviews.title: Coffee grounds get stuck to lid / inside and get everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Two stars because it does grind. The problem is the coffee grounds get stuck in the grinder. Have to use your finger or a brush to get coffee grounds out. They also stick to the lid so coffee grounds get everywhere. Significantly worse than our last coffee grounder. We're buying a new one and hoping it doesn't also suck.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this spice grinder!! I use it all the time! So quiet too!!
customer_reviews.author: Faith Clingenpeel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Ceylon Cinnamon Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to grind Ceylon cinnamon sticks and it works beautifully. I previousky tried using an expensive coffee grinder to do it, but this grinder is far superior. It's powerful and grinds quickly; in just a few seconds I had a little 1/4 cup canister full of healthy ground cinnamon.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Coffee and Spice Grinder
customer_reviews.text: All in all, I am pleased with my purchase of the Coffee and Spice Grinder . Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: This coffee grinder is almost perfect. It is quiet, sharp, fast, and attractive. So far it has always worked flawlessly. It can be a tad difficult to get all the grinds out, but I really don't mind that much and I love the thing. Writing this review makes me want to go and make some coffee with it. It is also quite easy to clean, which surprised me!
customer_reviews.author: HarvestSong

customer_reviews.title: Good Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I use this primary for coffee beans, but it will grind up most things (salt crystals, seeds, peppercorns, dried herbs). The trick with this, as with ALL grinders is to avoid getting water inside it when cleaning. Turn it upside down, wipe with a damp cloth/paper/sponge) and dry immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Did not work right out of box
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this grinder back in February but didnt open it till today to grind some Coriander seeds and the unit does not work. Pretty poor quality to not even turn on when plugged in for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: EdandMelody G.

customer_reviews.title: Coffee sticks to grinder.
customer_reviews.text: Coffee sticks to bottom of grinder. Does not pour out easily. Need a brush or spoon to clean it out.
customer_reviews.author: Pawson,J

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet
customer_reviews.text: Love this grinder, super quiet and strong. My hubbie wanted a spice grinder and this is the best. He was using it and I was shocked as I didn't hear it at all, he had a giant smile on his face!
customer_reviews.author: quilter101

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: So quiet, I can sleep through it! Really good grinder for our needs. Only one little draw back, to make a 12 cup pot we would have to make 2 grindings. But that does not happen often. Really pleased with this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Alain

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: I used this grinder once and didn't use it again for about a month. It stopped working altogether! It's my second coffee grinder from Amazon, and I've had no luck. Ended up going to Walmart to get an operational one for under $20.00.
customer_reviews.author: L. J.  Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 6 months! I don't even use it frequently. Coffee bean is the only item I use this grinder for, and I grind my coffee every 2 weeks, and after use, I just wipe it clean. I do not soak the grinder in water or soap. Don't know what could cause it to just shut off! Only explanation: poor quality!
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.title: Worked well while it lasted....
customer_reviews.text: This worked well while it lasted but the safety tabs which slide into place when the lid goes on broke and now it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Sharp!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other grinders that left my spices "torn" or "dinged" but never truly ground. This one is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Hern

customer_reviews.title: Good bean grinder
customer_reviews.text: Works good for whole ground beans . Not the easiest to clean but otherwise it works pretty good . Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I use grinder to grind up flax seeds. It basically grinds everything well, for the most part. I wish it were easier to clean. You can't remove the little cup part where things are grinder so you just have to wipe it with a wet rag. I'm not OCD...but it bothers me a little. The fact that I only use it for flax seeds is the saving grace (regarding cleanliness).
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nifty while it worked, but broke after one year
customer_reviews.text: This grinder was great while it lasted but it broke after just one year of use. The little plastic mechanism on the lid that tells the machine "it's closed, you can grind now" broke... basically making this useless.
customer_reviews.author: shorty323

customer_reviews.title: It worked awesome, even though my cuisinart mini prep was not ...
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is fabulous! It arrived in two days, as promised. I took it out of the box, plugged it in and used to grind my flax seed for my smoothie in a matter of seconds. It worked awesome, even though my cuisinart mini prep was not able to accomplish this task. It is a great deal for your money and I would highly recommend this product. The canister is smaller than 1 cup, so you can use it for a bulk amount, but it works great for what I need it for!
customer_reviews.author: MargieK6

customer_reviews.title: Secura Electric Coffee Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I've bought compact grinders in the past but they were hopeless! All Secura products so far have proven worthy of purchasing!
customer_reviews.author: Shri Stefanelli

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! DIDN'T EVEN LAST A WEEK!
customer_reviews.text: This was the worst piece of equipment I've ever purchased! The thing after 1 week stopped working! It doesn't turn on!!! Its literally dead, I only used it once! I will never purchase their products ever again!
customer_reviews.author: Emon Khan

customer_reviews.title: Heckuva Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I have seen mixed reviews on this little coffee grinder, but in my opinion it is a great little grinder for the price. Following directions not to grind for more than 30 seconds yields the perfect amount of fresh coffee beans. I wish it had a built-in cord storage-- but it doesn't. Still, knowing about Amazin's no hassle return policy---I wouldn't return. This is a cool little unit that serves its purpose. 'Nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Elizabeth McEvoy

customer_reviews.title: I love the coffee and spice grinder
customer_reviews.text: I love the coffee and spice grinder! I use it everyday - it is easy to use, easy to clean and makes great coffee. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: rose

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great on seed mixes ... including flax seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Broedel

customer_reviews.title: Simply that it works for what I need it for.
customer_reviews.text: I really cannot give an opinion as to its use as of yet, because I have not had a chance to use it, but I'm sure it will be just fine, at least it got delivered in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: though its really easy to spill grinds after opening it
customer_reviews.text: Does its job well, though its really easy to spill grinds after opening it. I had to develop a method of tapping the sides to get them to settle right and not spill out.
customer_reviews.author: Dante

customer_reviews.title: This is my second purchase of this grinder. It ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this grinder. It works for maybe 3 grinds and then it just stops working. Unfortunately I only use it on weekends for coffee and so both times I'm outside of the return window. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: K. M.

customer_reviews.title: sturdy grinder. I have had it for more than ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my Cuisinart grinder, which broke. I chose this make and model after reading positive reviews. This is a well-made, sturdy grinder. I have had it for more than a month now and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Fidge

customer_reviews.title: Great, just don't return!!!
customer_reviews.text: Only negative is the fact that I ordered two in error, reported immediately, waited for return label, sent back in original packaging and then was penalized in my refund.....why??? Otherwise a great little grinder...a gift for my husband and he loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: patsuit

customer_reviews.title: Only run for 30 secs?
customer_reviews.text: In general the product works as it should, but having to stop after 30 seconds to let it rest (for some unstated period of time) is an inconvenience. It also tends to spill grinds when the lid is removed, and taking it off carefully only lessens the problem. Although this one looks nicer, I prefer my old Hamilton Beach due to its cleaner serving capability.
customer_reviews.author: C. Malek

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use but kind of hard to clean inside. It grinds perfect though.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use but kind of hard to clean inside. It grinds perfect though.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Lara

customer_reviews.title: Stylish Secura GRINDER  works as well as it looks!
customer_reviews.text: Secura Grinder has made grinding spices and even grinding desiccated coconut a breeze ! Very easy to use and it grinds evenly and quickly. Would recommend and buy again if needed for a gift.
customer_reviews.author: sonia

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great machine , easy to use, good quality. BUT---very small (wish it was twice as large), and hard to clean up. Does great grinding up the coffee beans. Would recommend and would buy again because of the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda M.(Kenneth M.)

customer_reviews.title: Great product, for an exceptionally reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this grinder for three years. I just use it for coffee. It is a workhorse, always works well and is equally efficient today as when it was brand new. It is well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle  Atlas

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: EAsy to use and looks very nice on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Chamberlin

product_meta.title: Secura Electric Coffee and Spice Grinder with Stainless Steel Blades
product_meta.description: Electric grinder for coffee bean and spices; Build-in smart overheat protection, extend motor life span; Lid safety lock, On/Off switch; Stainless steel blade and stainless steel exterior; Cord wrap base
feature_bullets: Electric grinder for coffee bean and spices
Build-in smart overheat protection, extend motor life span
Lid safety lock, On/Off switch, Cord wrap base
Stainless steel blade and stainless steel exterior
Product Built to North American Electrical Standards, 120V.
